Reviews.Title: “Smallest Hotel Rooms in the World?”
Reviews.Author: KikouOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers rooms in the running for the title of Smallest Hotel Rooms in the World. The rooms here are so small that those with luggage will find that they need to put the suitcases into the bathroom first to be able to close the hotel room door upon arrival and departure. Then once the door is closed, you'll have the swing space to put the case into the room. The window ledge is the only option where to place a case - there is not even enough floor space to open an average size suitcase. The window saved me from feeling claustrophobic. The most notable thing about the room is that the toilet is in the shower stall. Showering even with the showerhead pointed to the left wall will wet the toilet paper (and seat!) on the right wall. The hotel is clean, offers few amenities and their bar was not open very late so no food was available. There is a hairdryer in the room and two small bottles of water provided. The staff is not service oriented or helpful. I asked for some ice and the front desk team was able to provide it to me if I could bring down a cup from my room. I wondered why they couldn't just provide me a glass instead of forcing me to return to my room to get a glass to fill with the ice. Later, I asked for restaurant recommendations and the many front desk staff just said "we're not going to help these local restaurant owners", which was unhelpful for me. The location is a little far from the downtown but close to some outdoor food stands. If lighting is your need, this is the right place to stay; otherwise it is not an interesting neighbourhood. All the shops on this street seem to sell lamps. I traveled solo but the bed was huge so I doubt other rooms given to couples are any bigger. Based on the size of the room and the location/ dull neighbourhood, I'd recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bar Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: DemonTW
Reviews.Content: There is a Bar/Cafe located in this hotel and the hospitality the staffs there are simply great. They offer free valuable advice on where to head and dine. Beers & Liquors are at affordable prices. Good job guys.

Reviews.Title: “Shoebox of a room but very clean”
Reviews.Author: nayjoy
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered very clean, modern rooms which despite their size were perfect for just a place to sleep after full days sightseeing in Singapore. As a family of 4 we needed to separate over two rooms on the same floor, sharing a queen bed in each room with a child each. Unfortunately they could only accommodate on a smoking floor to be able to keep both rooms together on the same level. Given the opportunity again I would have much preferred for us to be on separate floors to avoid the smoking floor. If you are not a smoker please bear in mind that the smoke was completely unbearable to the point where we had to run a towel along the base of the door and open the window to humid Singapore weather just to get rid of the smoke from the air, it was thick. The staff were quite helpful in reception and helped with directions, taxi wherever possible. Their English skills were quite good. Our room attendant was brilliant she was friendly, kept the rooms immaculate and also her service was exceptional. The hotel was approx. 15 minutes by bus to the CBD and after catching the bus a couple of times we realized that the taxi was so inexpensive. I think it only cost about $8 - $10 Singapore each way. Price was very fair for the accommodation given the quality of the rooms and of course this is Singapore where accommodation is more on the expensive side. In fact it was great value for money. The size of the room was a bit claustrophobic but perfect because we were only there to sleep. The bathroom in one of the rooms was smaller and it did almost feel like you were showering over the toilet in a tiny bathroom cubicle, it seemed to be because of the layout of one of the corner rooms. It was quiet enough. There were also plenty of suitable places to eat with a couple of food courts within close proximity on the other side of the road, plenty of restaurants and also some Hawkers markets nearby as well. There were no restaurant or breakfast facilities at the hotel when we stayed there in May 2011. The area is reasonably busy but we found it quiet and slept well. There was no fridge in the room. I would definitely recommend this accommodation for business travelers who are not concerned about being just out of the CBD area. I would also recommend for families with older children who would not be spending much time at the hotel and who don't need to be entertained or need lots of room because there is only enough room to just walk around the bed and into the toilet. The rooms are extremely compact. I would definitely stay here again with no hesitation BUT on a non smoking floor.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: elgor
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were very disappointed with this hotel. The rooms were miniscule with the vanity in the bedroom. The toilet was virtually under the shower. There was no fridge in the room and we had trouble walking around the bed due to lack of space. The suitcase had to be left under the hand basis. No breakfast available here. The hotel is not close to a MRT station but does have a bus stop just over the road. There is a McDonalds close by for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, well-appointed”
Reviews.Author: mistsy
Reviews.Content: In the context of Singapore, this is a great place to stay. In a city where a name-brand hotel is upwards of $300, this place is a bargain. Your room will be so small that there isn't room enough for two, even in the "queen" room, which, by Western standards is just slightly wider than a cot with just inches to spare on either side. That's about the only downside. There's an in-room safe, electric kettle, a/c, the hot water works, and there's an elevator. Your bath is pint-sized and when you shower, so does the entire little bath, including the toilet. Some people are grossed out by that but it's pretty common in Asia. There's a nice little lobby. The hotel is well-situated along a busy road but it's still quiet. The road outside has a million little cheap (really cheap) Chinese eateries and just up the road (walking distance) are a bunch of chain and fast-food joints along with a mall with a decent supermarket in the basement. That, and if you're in need of lighting or bathroom fixtures, you'll find it just steps away! Virtually out the door is a bus stop that takes you to various places including the MRT (metro) station at Novena. There are also a bunch of other cheap hotels along the road... and when I say cheap, we're talking Singapore cheap. That $50 Ibis you find around Europe is nearly $200 US here. The staff is pretty nice too. Below this price, you have a few other decent hotels around but there are precious few of them of this quality. Your next-best choice, I guess, would be one of the hostels but I was never very good at sharing things with strangers, much less a bedroom with bunks in it. If in Singapore again, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again though I wonder what I'd do if it was more than just me...

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jurgendhondt
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 2 times last year traveling around Southeast Asia. The rooms are small but very clean, it's a great place if you just want a place to sleep and sightseeing all-day thru the city. The receptionists are friendly and helpful There is a subway station nearby (10 minutes walk)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jessica A
Reviews.Content: Although the room are very small, but it accomodate the basic need of a few nights stay. I like the place and location. The receptionist there is also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay and Move around Singapore”
Reviews.Author: KamilahR
Reviews.Content: We have chosen this hotel due to the reviews on Tripadvisor and we are glad we did. We got to Singapore by train from Kuala Lumpur at 6.00 am and around that time we also got into hotel, in spite of checking in policy which I think allows customers to check in, in afternoon time, we got our room strait away in the early morning at our arrival as we been very tired after the all night journey. That was surprising, because if you been to other Asian countries you will notice that Singapore its quite strict to its rules (no haggling with taxi, no transport of cigarettes into Singapore or products with price tags from other countries, otherwise you will be in trouble) I found room a bit funny by being so compact, however we read before that rooms at Singapore are very tiny, so we knew what to expect, room wasn't that small, but obviously having bathroom (shower) inside the room, and the toilet inside the shower cabin behind glass wall, makes impression of something different. Rooms are very clean, nice and tidy, room design its quite modern and updated. However its not like we spent any time chilling in the room as being in the city made us go out a lot and spend time outside. Location its fine, but not the best, we travelled by sub everywhere in the city, closes sub station was 15 min walk then catching a bus, passing two bus stops, and there you have sub station, or you can catch a taxi from the hotel strait to the tube, where you can start your journey. We found taxi very expensive comparable to UK prices or even more, so sub was great option, pick up the sub map from the reception at the hotel plus few good tips on location. Opposite hotel its mall and MCd and Kfc, that was our breakfast spot to start a day, mall has also supermarket downstairs and cash point inside this supermarket. Overall impression of the hotel its great the only downfall was a location in a way and taxi prices, and that what you need to be prepared for, however hotel itself will deliver all what you could expect.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: HendrikTatan
Reviews.Content: Good value for money,very clee An,good service,but a little bit fat for mrt,but have alternative route by bus....

Reviews.Title: “Smokey”
Reviews.Author: David K
Reviews.Content: Very niicely appointed Hotel for location & rate, jsut be sure when you book a room you ask for NON smoking. Had a comfortable stay however the room was the worst I have ever expereinced for smoke tainting...

Reviews.Title: “Quite small, but good value for money”
Reviews.Author: FrancescoR
Reviews.Content: I've been in this hotel for three nights during a short trip as tourist in the city. I was traveling alone so I booked a single room. The position is very good not very far from the center even if the MRT station is quite far away. Rooms are confortable and clean, even if very small. But considering the normal prices for 3-star hotels in Singapore, they are good enough. There is a flatscreen tv but just with local channels. Internet wifi was available for free, but during my stay was very slow and sometimes it didn't work at all. Breakfast was not provided during my stay. Anyway, Aqueen is a good hotel that I can recommend to everyone that is not disturbed by very small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in a decent location.”
Reviews.Author: Time2SeeItAll
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and don't have any significant complaints. The hotel is on Balestier Road so it's easy to find. Check-in was fast and easy, same with checking out. The room was clean, but the shower leaked onto the carpet every time we used it. The bed was nice and firm, and there was total blackout when the curtains were drawn. There was enough room to move around for 2 adults and 2 large suitcases. The metro isn't what I'd call close by, but staff suggested taking the bus to the train. It only took us about 10 minutes to walk to the station, IMHO I don't think this is too difficult at all. We'd certainly return to this hotel if the location suited us again like it did this time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, especially if you need a light fixture!”
Reviews.Author: bdwood2000
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel, mid-afternoon from Nusa Lembongan, Bali: culture shock! Singapore is clean and green, very impressive. The front desk was professional; I wouldn't say friendly and certainly not rude. The room was small, everything needed was almost within arm's reach. The location was good, frequent buses to the MRT and areas within the city. Orchard Road shopping was 20 minutes away, and we walked to "Little India". Across the street is a movie theater and many restaurants are close by. We were entertained and and well fed! We stayed three nights, just the right amount; the hotel is functional and simple, with no food served. Again, this was not a problem, there are places to eat everywhere. The one negative: there seemed to be an over-abundant use of air freshener, to the point of over-powering. This area may have more lighting stores than restaurants; and like I said, there were plenty of places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Cleaning Staff is taking things from the room!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hanna S
Reviews.Content: Pretty nice small hotel. But the negative issue is: The cleaning staff stole some of my items from my room. The staff just appologized, but I am not sure if they took the consequences. Dont bring any valuables to this hotel or use the safe as your things are not safe there.

Reviews.Title: “Great for one person”
Reviews.Author: pyragelos
Reviews.Content: I really liked my room (302). It is tiny but very practical. Good lighting and large window, large safe (big enough to fit a laptop), complimentary bottled water (x2) and a huge plasma tv I didn't use. The shower/toilet corner is indeed very small and everything gets wet when you shower so you may have to plan ahead a bit and it can be very awkward if you are sharing the room with someone else as there is absolutely no privacy in there. The bed is on the firm side but comfortable (for one person) and there is no noise at night. My only quibble was the aircon which seemed to be too cold even when set to 27 degrees so I ended up having it off most of the time. I think the price is fair (compared to other hotels in singapore). I was kept waiting for quite some time at check-in but the receptionist was very apologetic and polite. The free wifi works well most of the time. There is also a laundry service but I didn't use it. The hotel is on a very busy street so it is easy to get a taxi, which you may need to since it's either that or the bus. There is no food available in the hotel, but there are two shopping malls across the street (Balestier Plaza and Shaw Plaza/Twin Heights) and restaurants on either side, so you can get pretty much anything you need. Overall it is a great choice for a short, solo trip.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: shaigirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an overnight stay. The room accommodation is worth the cost your paying in Singapore. You'll have the necessities you need. The room is clean, neat and well thought-of in terms of interior design. It has an in-safe (big enough to fit your standard size laptop), small cabinet for you to hang your clothes (that comes w/ clothes hangers of course), coffee & tea-making stuff, 2 bottled drinking water (replenished everyday), small area to place your laptop AND most importantly a stool so you won't tire slouching on your bed if you want to work on your laptop. It has free wifi connection inside the room assigned to you upon check-in. There are small items in the room worth to mention which shows how the hotel wants to be at par along other standard hotels like their hotel-personalized notepad, stationery sheets, letter envelope and pencil. The toiletries are complete like shower gel, shampoo, disposable toothbrush and toothpaste, disposable shaver and cream, shower cap, bath and hand towels even slippers. Overall, I was impressed with the room accommodation and overall hotel-amenities. The elevator is accessible only by guests of the hotel as you cannot press your floor without tapping your room access-card. By the way, the room access is via tapping as well. The hotel's vicinity is also good as its just across Balestier Plaza which is a commercial building that has bank/atm, laundry shops even hair salons. A few meters away is the Shaw Plaza which has the Fair Price grocery in the basement, McDonalds, KFC, local atms and other shops even decent cinemas on the upper level. The only downside I can think of is that its not so near Novena MRT. For me, its still far walk which takes about more than 20minutes down Thomson Road then another down the road along Balestier. I usually take taxi to/from Novena Square and Aqueen Hotel (taxi fare averages to SGD5.00). Also they do not have business facilities like if you want to print your airline boarding pass. Balestier Road is a pleasant residential/commercial area, I have been there last March and stayed for about 2 weeks in a not so distant hotel down Thomson Road. Aqueen is far far better than this Hotel. Hotel staff in Aqueen is far friendlier and accommodating. Thumbs up to Aqueen Hotel Balestier and keep up the great quality hotel service.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but new and great value”
Reviews.Author: chicagoball
Reviews.Content: Balestier Road is still one of my favourite locations for value hotels. Nice restaurants nearby and a fast & easy bus ride to Novena MRT and mall. The hotel is relatively new and is located next to the Boon Tong Kee restaurant. Checkin was nice as the desk clerk let me check in at 10am. Room was tiny but everything is quite new. The bathroom is one of those where the shower and toilet are in the same area so everything gets wet. Nice flat screen tv and decent bed. Free internet is also very appreciated. A decent hotel if you just need a bed to sleep in. Priced very well.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: Anam92
Reviews.Content: it was good.clean & comfortable.Staffs were good.Room was small.there was no key but they gave a card.from that card the door will open.it is a safe hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but clean budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christiepax
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite okay for budget travellers. It's a little far from areas of interest. On our first night going back to the hotel we had a really long tiring walk from the nearest MRT station (Novena). So next time we went out we had to take a bus (bus nos. 21 and 131). And it was a breeze since then. The room is quite small but still ok for us. The bed has some hard areas that actually caused some pain on my back after the 2nd night. The room smelled cigarette smoke. We requested to be transferred to a non smoking room and the front desk staff said our room is actually a non smoking room. She just brought a humidifier turned on for an hour. The smell persisted during our 6D5N stay. The hotel's location, Balestier road, is near some nice restaurant so eating is not a problem even though the hotel doesn't have a "real" caffeteria/restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Advantageous Location”
Reviews.Author: musafir11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the busy Ballestier street that has close proximity to almost all the city's attraction. The closest MRT station (Novena) is a 10 minute bus ride away. You can hop on to most buses that stop on the bus stop right outside the hotel. The hotel is flanked by all kinds of eateries. Right across the road there is Shaw Plaza that takes care of the shopping needs. The only dampner is the size of the room that is way to small. There was less than a foot of space around the bed. however they are spotlessly clean. The biggest thumbs up is the location, and the biggest thumbs down the size of the room. A good option in case you prefer to return to the hotel only to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with basic facilties and free Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: KYC_Herbert
Reviews.Content: The best thing is free and high speed Wi-Fi as many hotels would charge you on this (S$20 per day in a 4 star hotel). All the facilties expected for a comfortabke stay are there. Although room is small (no proper table) but adequate for me. As for the location, it is far from MRT, but if you do some work on the internet (they have an excellent website for local transport in Singapore), it is not too difficult to get around. Do also note there are many food stalls around and also a supermarket and even a cinema nearby. For the price they cahrge, it is certainly good value for money Be prepare for some traffic noise from the street if you donot come from busy city like Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “A good option”
Reviews.Author: byjing0h
Reviews.Content: The Aqueen Hotel Balestier is about 20 minutes walk from the Novena rail station which is just two stops away from the Orchard Rd (city) station. I had a single room that was tiny but clean and otherwise comfortable with an in-room safe. Local phone calls and Wifi are free. Staff are courteous. The single room is best for one person, two may find it very cramped. I have stayed at this hotel on three occasions and never had a problem. The airport shuttle to this hotel costs $9 per person. Make sure the driver knows which Aqueen hotel you want as there is another Aqueen hotel at Lavender. It is possible to walk to this hotel from the Novena rail station. Exit the station on the hospital side and walk straight down Irrawaddy Road until you get to Balestier Rd. Turn right and walk past two big food courts on your right before you get to the hotel –also on your right. It will take you about 15 minutes and there are one or two spots where you will have to lift your luggage up a few stairs as the footpaths are not all the same height. There may be a quicker way from Novena but it may not be as straightforward. There are frequent buses that run from the station to the hotel but I have never seen anyone on them with large items of luggage. There are plenty of food courts nearby with a Macdonald’s outlet across the road on the right hand side. The Novena complex (near the station) also has a many food options that cater for local and western tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but very functional”
Reviews.Author: redladybiker
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a cheaper room in Singapore, which you will know is very difficult if you have tried. I found this hotel and booked direct on their website. The reception was reasonable, the room was very tiny, and the shower room was even smaller, but the room was in a reasonable condition, very functional, it had been designed with a great deal of thought to fit everthing you need into the smallest space possible. For one night it was no problem, but it you wanted to use it as a base, and had more than one piece of luggage, you would have problems. The bed was firm and it appearded to be smaller than a normal double but without a tape measure I cannot confirm that. We are two bigish people so it was uncomfortable for us, my tip would be book a twin room, even if the space was small you would at least have a decent sleep. In walking distance of many resturants and shops, but you would need to get a taxi to nearest MRT. Taxi cost approx $4 Singapore dollors. Free internet, but no other facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient location to get taxis”
Reviews.Author: angsana_tree
Reviews.Content: No breakfast in this Aqueen but convenience stores and local coffee shops abound. VERY bad location to try and get taxis. There are also many working girls staying here although they do not conduct 'business' on the premises, or so we think. All in all, the presence of such 'clientele' makes this hotel really seedy.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, small rooms but very clean and close to all amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Tr0yJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at end of November 2010 on recommendation from friend. Staff were very pleasant and courteous. Rooms are very small but clean. Free Complimentary Wi-Fi extremely fast and free complimentary local calls. Constuction going on next to hotel but only during daytime so sleep was never disturbed. Only two "complaints": Ensuite was extremely small with shower spraying over toilet, and no bar fridge. Neither "complaint" would stop me from staying there again or recommending hotel to others. Located on Balestier Rd means taxi's, buses, food halls, Shaw Plaza, Balestier Plaza all outside the front of the hotel. Keen walkers can make it to Nouvena MRT or just catch taxi. Price may be high for budget hotel but location and other plus' outweigh negatives.

Reviews.Title: “I Did it Again...”
Reviews.Author: ChelseyTS
Reviews.Content: Once again i stayed & came back in this hotel for 1 month stay & nothing changes. The staff are still friendly, polite & accomodating. its still the best budget hotel i love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Aqueen Value for money”
Reviews.Author: venuscindia
Reviews.Content: Singapore being one of the costliest cities in the world has some good budget hotels, one among them is Aqueen Baliester where the access is fantastic to Bus and MRT good restaurants around and nice cozy hotel. The staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Awful smell!”
Reviews.Author: JimOrtega
Reviews.Content: The first day I checked into the hotel room, I was greeted with an awful smell of disinfectant, I think. It was powerful. Then inside the room, their housekeeping left a deodorizer machine I think and another machine which I don't know what the purpose is. Well, after I left the room to do some sightseeing, when I came back the 2 machines are gone. Seems this hotel is really careless, leaving those machines when they know a guest is already checking in. Also they didn't bother to change the tissue in the roller, so that when I tried to get some, it was almost used up. There's also no in room safe contrary to what they advertise that they have in room safes in the rooms. It's not cheap either, I paid 113 Singapore dollars for this one. Also no early check in which pissed me off.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: MissElainey
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel. I had looked at their web site before departing do the basic layout was expected. They are basic rooms. But the toilet in the shower is pretty gross. There is a manky shower curtain to separate the two, but it is stained and moldy as is the ceiling making the room a bit smelly. The beds are very firm but the air conditioner is very good. There is a small selection of tv channels and a couple if radio stations. BUT the impression of the web site I got was that there was a cafe in operation. There is a cafe type apace but it is just that a space. An the only btekfast provider around is the MCdonalds across the street. And yes there is wifi but it failed the day I arrived for several hours and a pretty weak signal when activel but it is free.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: leogp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here four 4 nights, the hotel is new and its very clean and do not have any bad smell. The hotel is located in a main road and its easy to hail a cab. The rooms is small but enough only for two person. The bus stop is a two minute walk from the hotel and there is a lot of local restaurant around the area..I think the old cleaning lady needs more training on hospitality and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: Marique24
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not so bad except that the location was quite far from the usual tourist destinations. It's a 2-min walk to the nearest bus station, a 10min-bus ride to the nearest MRT. Considering this, it's still not so bad since there's a lot of good local restaurants nearby. If you're not a fan of local food, there are 2 malls across the street, the Balestier Plaza and the Shaw Plaza where you'll find Mickey Ds and other western food chains. My room was regularly cleaned and you can request for water anytime. The room I got was fairly small, you can barely walk around but then again, I would normally just go back to my hotel to sleep so I dont really need a big leisurely room. In short, you get what you paid for and considering that, I think I would go back to this hotel for what it's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with Free Wifi - good for business travelers on a budget”
Reviews.Author: terry888
Reviews.Content: This is a clean hotel with friendly service. Room is very small but sufficiently comfortable for a business traveler. The best thing is the free Wifi which normally cost around SGD 28 per day in other hotels. Only problem is that they have only 3 parking lots which is on a first come first serve basis. If you park outside make sure you have bought parking coupons from the 7 eleven stores (available at all Shell station). Near food stalls which is open to late hour in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but small rooms...”
Reviews.Author: theseamaster
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little bit faraway from MRT (Singapore Metro) - walking from nearest station (Novena) could be reasonable anywhere else, but not in the heat of Singapore. The room was very elegant and trendy but was also so small that you could get from the bed to the wc with a single step... The air con (which only works when the keycard is inserted in the slot) was incredibly weak so the first night I couldn' t sleep until 3,00 am; the next day I asked the reception if they could give me a second key to leave in the slot so that the air con could start cooling the room while I was away; they kindly agreed, so the next night I was alright. Unfortunately there is a huge building site opposite to the room (they just started digging the foundations now, so I don' t think they' ll finish before the end of 2011 at least); again the reception seemed to agree to give me a room facing the other side, which at the end I didn' t ask because the construction work started at 8,00 am, a pretty reasonable time for me. Anyway if you are booking here and plan to spend some time during the day in the room, you should consider this. The hotel management are doing their best, but unfortunately and despite the very reasonable rates, at the moment I wouldn' t consider this hotel a very good choice for staying in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, peaceful and safe.”
Reviews.Author: shafeek1
Reviews.Content: nice cozy hotel.very clean.had a quiet and peaceful stay there.with a tourist pass u can take the bus and get to the novena mrt in 10 min and anywhere else with the mrt.kind and helpful staff.room well equipped and cleaned everyday.loved the electronic do not disturb signs.free wifi and inland calls.room a bit small,but i guess that;s normal singapore size.still it included an lcd tv, kettle, glasses and cups and enough cupboards for me.even had an electronic safe for valuables.nobody came to disturb at any time.it was a safe place.next door was a 24 hr eatery..though i didnt try it, lots of people seemed to like it. overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff...nice location & comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: ChelseyTS
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel twice already for 2months each stay...the 1st time i stayed is when they have opened it(that was still soft opening last may 2009)...all the staff are nice to me & very friendly especially to cyrel, monika, jewell, camilla & shirley(who give me discounted rate since im staying long term...they are always attentive to ur needs...will be staying again when i come back to singapore soon...

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel, Rigid Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Gibbirish
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in this Hotel for 3 Nights. This is not the place to stay on a vacation. Probably good for a nights stay on a business visit. 1. Boring Location: Nothing to see in the surrounding locality except a Buddhist temple. The nearest MRT station is at Novena for which you have to take a Bus. But thanks to the excellent public transportation system of Singapore, this should not be a problem. 2. Tiny Room: Rooms are Tiny!! Bathroom is very Tiny. (U can see in the pic attached). Its triangular shaped and about 6 ft width, probably not enough place for a fat person to move about!!! The rooms had facilities like TV, hair dryer, soaps and other accessories. It was clean enough and the bed was comfortable. 3. Uncourteous Staff: Staff can probably take a lesson or two on hospitality. We encountered rigid staff. Our flight arrived in morning, but we were made to sit in lobby till 2 pm. This despite informing them in advance about our early arrival. We had extended the check out till 6 pm by paying half day price. Since my wife was feeling tired and needed rest, I asked if we could check out one hour later. They said we have to pay the entire days fee in that case. During check out the reception staff was inattentive and after moving out of the hotel, she summoned us back again to take our signature. Which she could and should have taken when we were waiting in front of her!!! 4. Attached cafeteria: There is a small Cafe attached which provides breakfast for about 10 SGD. Besides this cafe, the hotel has no other amenities. 5. Price: was 88 SGD/ night, which was very affordable. But retrospectively, I feel it would have been better to shell out a little more and take a 3 star hotel instead. This hotel had great previous reviews and thus we had opted it. Unfortunately it did not stand upto our expectation. I do not recommend this for people going with families or those going on a vacation. Lone travelers, especially those on a business visit, looking for a place to sleep and get fresh, can consider this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, in a so-so location”
Reviews.Author: DonTobi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights during a recent trip to Singapore. The hotel itself is very nice, clean, has a modern feel to it, and had a very friendly staff. I always enjoyed coming back after a long day of sightseeing. I must also note that international phone calls were very cheap, which is definitely not the norm. Only the location is not ideal. While there are frequent busses along the road, I usually opted to either walk 15 minutes to the nearest MRT station, or take a taxi, which is anywhere between S-$6 and S-$12, depending on time of day.

Reviews.Title: “En excelent quality/price hotel”
Reviews.Author: misflopes
Reviews.Content: The staff is extremely kind, efficient and helpful. The rooms are very quite, there is no noise from the other rooms or from outside. Although the hotel is not locatted right in the centre of the city, there are very frequent buses just in front of the hotel that connect with the excelent subway (named in Singapore as mrt). The room was very small (tiny indeed) and simple but extremely clean, pleasant and airy, with a very large window. The bathroom was also very small but nice and clean. Excelent quality/price ratio! Isabel Lopes, Coimbra, Portugal

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: teemsaj
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel and came to know from an email received in our travel company where I work. Read about other hotels in Singapore on TripAdvisor and the ones I liked within my budget were built long back and were mostly damp because of the tropical climate. This hotel was a welcome change being newly built. The location is not central, but made perfect sense for us as we arrived in Singapore in the evening and had to go for the night safari which is closer to the hotel on the MRT line till Ang Moo Kee from where there are buses to the safari. About the room: The room was tiny but well packaged with a queen sized bed occupying about 60% of the floor area. There was a shower-room right next to the bed along with a wash basin. LCD TV on the wall allowed space for a corner table - no place for chair in the room though. Also there was a cabinet for clothes along with an electronic safe. The place between the corner table and the cabinet, along the large window, presented with a flat place to sit or act as a table. About the hotel & staff: The hotel is also quite small with no dining facilities – only a small café, which we didn’t use as we didn’t have much time on hand. The staff on reception was courteous and check-in was quick. I had already made reservation over the email – they just charged my card at check-in. My sister called from India when we were out and a computer print-out message was slipped under the door of our room – I found it professional. The staff at the reception was helpful in telling us about the bus number that’ll take us to our destination and they also told us where nearby eating joints were. Balestier road is a sort of eating hot-spot with a couple of high-end restaurants and a food court within walking distance to the hotel. This is also one of the reasons why I chose this hotel – as staff of new hotel are more courteous and amenable to the needs of the customer. The staff tripped on the morning of check-out, when they gave the wake-up call half an hour late and we had to catch an early morning flight. The person at reception was sorry and apologetic. Even though we had already woken up before the call, but nonetheless a slip-up it was. At S$88 a night, this was a steal. Mind you this is an introductory offer – the regular rate is in the range of S$200 a night. But don’t think the regular rate justifies itself as one can stay in bigger hotels with dining facilities for S$200 a night.

Reviews.Title: “astounding!!”
Reviews.Author: SJM5
Reviews.Content: A great weekend "hide out" without the kids... rather unexpected furnishings despite the the location where budget hotels usually sited...i WILL head there again anytime...
